title: For Sale/Trade:  Jaguar-skin rug, last chance, OR residents only
postcontent: Last chance to purchase or trade for a jaguar skin rug!  This cannot be sold across state line and is available only through June 30.  You must show proof of Oregon residence.  This skin was brought back from Peru in 1960 in a diplomatic pouch by Margaret Forsythe.  She didn't say if she shot it or if someone else did after it caused problems. The skin is mounted on green felt backing and is in pretty good shape, but not perfect.  This wasn't a head mount - the head part of the skin is squashed and the ears are bare, but all in all, it is an attractive item. As a protected species, you can't get these any more.  $500 or trade for interesting firearm up or down.  I also collect old advertising relating to old gas stations, cars or guns.

title: For Sale:  Magnum Research Micro Desert Eagle
postcontent: Reluctantly selling my Magnum Research Micro Desert Eagle after promising the wife I would downsize after recently retiring.  Included is everything that came with it new, plus one extra magazine with the newer-style finger extension and a leather pocket holster that is basic but very well made.  I bought the MDE preowned from a LGS, but it appeared to have been fired very little.  I've only put 20 rounds through it, and it is esentially LNIB. The MDE is extremely well made, and the fit and finish is right up there with Seecamp, in my opinion.  The felt recoil is really light compared to other pocket .380's, and it's extremely accurate for such a small pistol.  These were not mass produced like the LCP, TCP and others, and therefore are somewhat rare...those who own them seem to keep them.  Cash only please, show Missouri ID and sign my bill of sale.  Please feel free to email me with questions, or for additional images.  Thanks for looking.
